body:
Nothing left for you at the moment. I keep getting side tracked with real work requirements. It's a big commit, so we'll need a lot of review.

@alopresto @markap14 @bbende @ijokarumawak @joewitt  once 1.7 is out the door I can try to find some time, but I'd like others to look at this because it's a non-trivial commit that brings in a big chunk of totally new functionality.

Does that mean this commit won't make the 1.7 release? We have some clients who are looking to leverage these processors, I just want to set their expectations accordingly.  

Thanks,
David

That's correct. I would recommend you build a custom bundle and deliver that because you can deliver NARs independent of the release. Then any bug fixes you find along the way can be merged into this PR in 1.8.

Also, FYI, we have two other big PRs that came in that are waiting. One's a big refactor of InfluxDB support and the other is a MarkLogic PR. Each of these tends to be the equivalent in difficult of reviewing half a dozen or more typical PRs so it can be hard to triage.
+1 LGTM, ran build with unit tests and tried a pyspark session with `print('Hi')`, verified it fails before the fix and passes after. Thanks for the fix! Merging to master

i dont think we should commit this into the codebase.  It could be fine to publish the bash script in the wiki page associated with release guide/validation.  We must also be clear this is good for things which are easily automated such as verification of sigs/hashes/build but for other things like actually testing nifi and the hard work of L&N review its an eyes-on game.
ok @joewitt, but did it work? ;)
How would we go about getting it on the wiki page?

I still cannot get "file filter" regex to work when doing recursive folders.  Could you give me any example of what the regex should be for recursive folders?  I already spent few hours on it but it is not intuitive so can't get anything working with modified regex for recursive folders.
+1 LGTM, thanks for the fix! merging to master
Reviewing...
@joewitt can you review the L&N? I added the new stuff, but wasn't sure if the existing dependencies that are covered elsewhere (Ex. Jackson and Bouncy Castle) had to also get added to the L&N here.

I verified this by starting the application and using browser developer tools to monitor the requests when loading the docs. All resource types (HTML, CSS, etc.) had the *X-Frame-Options* header set correctly. 

Ran `contrib-check` and all tests pass. +1, merging.
@zenfenan can you review?
As mentioned in the docs, the Confluent lib that I use for this uses extensions to Avro syntax to define the rules.
@mattyb149 can we close the loop on this?
Sure @MikeThomsen I'll take a look

Mike - i'll look when able.  In the mean time anything present in the resulting Nar(s) needs to be accounted for in the L&N of that nar.  The nar should probably not be added to the assembly for now since we're space constrained and it is for test purposes and someone could easily add it when needed.  Therefore, no need to update the nifi-assembly/L&N.

thanks
@alopresto I have made the suggested changes.  Unfortunately the build has been pulled, so the script won't run until next release.

@ottobackwards i'd recommend just moving this to be a bash script made available on the wiki and close the PR.

You could 
1. Propose an edit to the release process to make this available as an alternative way for folks who want to validate the RC (as an alternative to the current path)
2. Put this bash script on the wiki and link to it from #1.

Thanks
@joewitt I agree.  I'll see if I can edit the wiki ( if I have rights )

@joewitt so here's a thought... do you think it would be feasible to write a deployment process that pushes the extra nars (ex atlas, hive3 and this) to our GitHub repo's "releases" list? Or are there restrictions on space, etc.?
I do not have rights to create a page in the space from what I can tell

Not sure.  But we should just organize a proper effort to get an extension registry in play.  It will take some time but with us not being able to make the download larger we should be properly motivated to sort that out.
should have them now
I sent the email, I'll close this PR with the results of that when they are set
@joewitt @MikeThomsen  @alopresto  please take a look and let me know if this is enough
@ottobackwards I will review this but have been busy with the release process and some other priorities. Do you have a pressing need for this to be in `master`?
@alopresto No pressing need.  Honestly, I picked it off of the jira list, and you were the reporter.
Can you update the title of this pr to have more title?

@joewitt @alopresto This PR modifies code that was worked on by the two of you.  I think there will be some discussion of the fixes, but I wanted to get a PR up ASAP to start the review process.  Of interest, there's some exception handling changes in NiFi.java.  NiFiGroovyTest needs to be able to invoke the main method, and since it's a unit test, lib/bootstrap isn't available.  Creating a temp directory for the test didn't work out very well, based on varying PWD between surefire/IDE (resources under working-directory/target) and NiFi (the PWD), so I thought this would be an acceptable approach.
Thanks @bbende Merged to master
Forgot to add the 'This closes #PR' in the commit message so it is still shown as open. :|
Thanks @zenfenan ! will close the PR
The test failures are unrelated as far as I can tell
+1, ran few tests to confirm behavior, merging to master, thanks @mattyb149
+1, code LGTM, merging to master, thanks @zenfenan
+1, code LGTM, merging to master, thanks @patricker
Code LGTM. @zenfenan, could you rebase against master?
Merged, thanks @patricker
Three cheers.\
@bbende thanks Bryan I will review shortly
@apiri can you review?
@zenfenan can you review? I think we're almost at close out point.
hey @MikeThomsen.  thanks for tackling this.  I think I will have some time later tonight or tomorrow to scope it out.
@MikeThomsen thanks for the review.  I think I have addressed all the feedback, save the attributed naming feedback, which I have replied to.
@MikeThomsen I'm actually traveling with limited access to mails and internet. I'll try to take a look as soon as I can, if someone doesn't get to already.
@MikeThomsen Hi. Any change is in this PR to make secured-cluster?
@dkhwangbo we can set up a new ticket for adding that.
@apiri Can you review? It's only 3 lines of changes.
Thanks @MikeThomsen !
Reviewing...
reviewing...
+1, ran a build with the fix and confirmed expected behavior, merging to master, thanks @markap14
Will review...

What do you think about naming conventions consistent between the processors that do this "incremental commit"? I added this capability to QueryDatabaseTable under [NIFI-4836](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-4836), and not to say we have to use my namings, but as it is in product it might be better to have the properties and such be named and documented consistently. For example, QDT has a single property that takes a zero value to indicate that it should wait until all results are processed before sending the files downstream. What are your thoughts?

Hi @MikeThomsen, I'm going to politely ask that you revert the commit and re-open this PR and Jira. I commented earlier that I would review this and was busy with the 1.7.0 release process and some other security issues. 

1. I opened this Jira because I had a specific security-related need for this processor. @ottobackwards took the initiative to work on this, which I appreciate, but I did not have a chance to review this before you merged it. 
1. This is security-related content which (like all feature work) the community will need to support moving forward. This needs to be carefully reviewed. 
1. There is no rush to merge this; a release was just created, which means there will likely not be a new release for some time. I even checked with Otto to ensure that he did not have a pressing need for this.
@mattyb149 made the changes you requested.
@alopresto no problem. Sorry if it cause any inconvenience. Ticket seemed straight forward to me, but I'll let you take your time with it.
Jira reopened and commit reverted. @ottobackwards can you reopen?
I don't think I can re-open, but I can do another PR and link to this
Glad I didn't delete the branch
https://github.com/apache/nifi/pull/2836

@alopresto for future reference, if a commit has to be reversed (hopefully for not this reason), would adding `This opens #ABCD` to the revert commit message have the effect of reopening it? Seemed logical, but I didn't want to experiment on master.
Thanks @markap14! This has been merged to master.
I do not believe there is any way to currently open a PR with the commit message via a hook.

+1 LGTM, one of the unit tests in Travis is failing but it's not the fault of this code. I ran the unit tests and some tests on a live NiFi instance with "Infer" and "Schema Text" strategies, all looked well. Thanks for the addition! Merging to master
Sent mans2singh/nifi#1
+1, merging to master, thanks @mattyb149
+1, confirmed the change is working as expected, merging to master, thanks @MikeThomsen
@MikeThomsen - could you rebase against master? thanks!
@pvillard31 done.

Thanks @MikeThomsen - will wait for a final review from @apiri.
Out of curiosity, any reason why to use ``bitnami/zookeeper``?
@pvillard31 @zenfenan left me a note saying he's traveling with limited access right now, so I might do the rebasing and merging today myself.
I just copied the test stuff (including the custom transform JAR) from the JoltTransformJSON processor. I don't know where the source code is, perhaps @YolandaMDavis does
@MikeThomsen this looks good to me and will provide a nice start for folks to spin up a cluster as well as a basis for further extension.  thanks for your time and I'll merge this in.
@mattyb149 It's a different approach, but I see no issues. It's also more flexible, as it would add in the option for "Max Rows Per Flow File" in addition to output batching. I'll work on it.

Hey @MikeThomsen,

Made some adjustments on the great work you put in earlier to help support some use cases and provided some docs.  Would be interested in your input.

Thanks
Hey @davemssavage thanks for taking the time to submit a PR to fix the docs!  I'll get this merged in.
Reviewing...

Thanks @thenatog. I reviewed this and it looks good. While initially I tried to run integration tests for the entire project, there is a failing integration test `StandardControllerServiceProviderIT.testConcurrencyWithEnablingReferencingServicesGraph:96->testEnableReferencingServicesGraph` which I opened a ticket for [NIFI-5375](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-5375). Building normally and then running integration tests on just this module is successful. I made some minor fixes for code style (see [commit 8792f90](https://github.com/alopresto/nifi/commit/12503047009bac80da4858b8fc99da35a8792f90) on branch NIFI-5374-PR-2840). 

I verified against a running instance as well, and will merge this PR.

Before :

``` bash
grep -o 'deprecation' ../build.log | wc -l
     795
```

After:

```bash
grep -o 'deprecation' build.log | wc -l
     260
```

There seems to be a mix of deprecation fixes and formatting changes, are there any specific changes that warrant attention that you can point out?

Is there some other way to measure or test this that you would recommend?
build with contrib check is fine as well

Some were simply suppressed with an annotation if they were in a test class that specifically covered a deprecated class. The `NiFiLegacyCipherProvider` is an example. Some deprecated methods were switched to their follow-on methods, like `IOUtils.toString(Object)` to `IOUtils.toString(Object, Charset)`. The `StringEncryptor.createEncryptor()` switch is the only one that stands out to me as having logic changed, so that may be a good place to examine.
@peter-gergely-horvath @joewitt I can start reviewing this, but would like verification from both of you that the IP issues y'all talked about on dev are sufficiently squared away before I begin.

@MikeThomsen yes, this is fine from the standpoint of the IP. 

A bit of background: I had developed this piece of code internally, at my employer, which had to be pushed through _our_ open sourcing approval process. After that was done, I had internal talks with our practice director regarding contributing this back to NiFi and he confirmed this is to be done using the standard NiFi ASF license: so technically it is me, the person, who makes this contribution and not our organization.
@MikeThomsen @joewitt please let me know if you need anything else from my end.

@peter-gergely-horvath looks like you have a stylecheck failure. Did you build the maven module(s) you added using `mvn clean install -Pcontrib-check`? Looks like you have at least a few files that aren't licensed. Depending on what they are, you'll need to either add the license header or just exclude them from the RAT plugin's checks.

@MikeThomsen I tried, but it kept failing with other tests cases, unrelated to my changes, see above in pull request: 
```
At the moment, the build fails with unit test failures unrelated to this commit:
[INFO] Running org.apache.nifi.csv.TestCSVValidators
[INFO] Tests run: 7, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.018 s - in org.apache.nifi.csv.TestCSVValidators
[INFO] Running org.apache.nifi.csv.TestJacksonCSVRecordReader
[ERROR] Tests run: 11, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.033 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.nifi.csv.TestJacksonCSVRecordReader
[ERROR] testUTF8(org.apache.nifi.csv.TestJacksonCSVRecordReader)  Time elapsed: 0.002 s  <<< FAILURE!
org.junit.ComparisonFailure: expected:<[]> but was:<[???]>
	at org.apache.nifi.csv.TestJacksonCSVRecordReader.testUTF8(TestJ
```

The fact I cannot get a working build from original/master is kind of painful, do you see any way for me to remedy this?
OK, @MikeThomsen I see some further issues here: I'll close the pull request and try to rectify them.
You can ping me when you're ready.

You should send an email to users@nifi.apache.org with your question and configuration. `ListSFTP` accepts Expression Language in most of the processor properties, so you can reference the Variable Registry variables defined for that process group. This PR should be closed.
I think this PR is a little big for testing/reviewing right now. Going to split it up into a few separate tasks.

Flow Generator: https://flowalyzer-netflow-generator.soft112.com/
Flow Template: [NetFlowv5_Test_Template.zip](https://github.com/apache/nifi/files/2169500/NetFlowv5_Test_Template.zip)
[This template receives data over UDP and use this custom processor to parse it]
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/net_mgmt/netflow_collection_engine/3-6/user/guide/format.html - For more details ,Refer NetflowV5  section in this article.

Hope these will be useful.
Will review....

@markobean Thanks for the PR! I've tried running it and it does indeed address the issue called out in the JIRA. Previously, the infinite loop occurred when trying to configure the services in question. With the PR in place, I can now configure the services to build the reference cycle. However, if I try to enable them I encountered a different infinite loop here:

at org.apache.nifi.controller.service.StandardControllerServiceReference.findRecursiveReferences(StandardControllerServiceReference.java:125)

I also seem to recall that previously the framework would identify when a reference cycle was detected and it would set that flag in the `ControllerServiceReferencingComponentDTO`. I noticed in the UI after establishing the reference cycle, the framework did not appear to detect it. This may or may not be related to the infinite loop referenced above. I do not believe this infinite loop is a result of this PR, but it's something we should probably address now as well.

In my scenario service A did not reference any other service, service B referenced service A and C, and service C referenced service B. In your testing, did you happen to hit the same loop I did when trying to enable them?

@mcgilman Did you experience this behavior on the graph or in a unit test? After fixing the infinite loop locally I was never able to enable the controller services on the graph because they were never valid: A depends on B which depends on A. A is not enabled so B cannot be enabled and vice versa.
Anything not windows specific?
